FuncDef: The display vrrp binding admin-vrrp command displays the bindings between an mVRRP group and a common VRRP backup group, between an mVRRP group and a VRRP-disabled interface, and between an mVRRP group and a service PW.
CLIs: display vrrp binding admin-vrrp [ interface { <interface-name1> | <interface-type1> <interface-number1> } ] [ vrid <admin-virtual-router-id> ] [ { [ member-vrrp [ interface { <interface-name2> | <interface-type2> <interface-number2> } ] [ vrid <member-vrid-value> ] ] | [ member-interface [ interface { <interface-name3> | <interface-type3> <interface-number3> } ] ] | [ member-pw [ vsi <vsi-name> peer <peer-address> [ negotiation-vc-id <negotiation-vc-id> ] ] ] } ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type and number of an interface on which an mVRRP group is configured.
-

Specifies the type and number of an interface on which a member VRRP backup group is configured.
-

Specifies the ID of an mVRRP group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the ID of a member VRRP backup group.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 255.

Displays configurations of a specified member VRRP.
-

Displays configurations of a specified member interface.
-

Displays configurations of a specified member PW.
-

Specifies the name of a VSI.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer router.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the ID of a virtual link.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295 and cannot be the same as the VS ID.

Examples: Interface: GigabitEthernet3/0/5, admin-vrrp vrid: 1, state: Master
Interface: GigabitEthernet3/0/5, admin-vrrp vrid: 1, state: Master
Interface name: GigabitEthernet3/0/5.1, type: VLAN, state: Up
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After configuring a binding for an mVRRP group, run the display vrrp binding admin-vrrp command to check the configuration. If the status of an object bound to an mVRRP group becomes abnormal, run the display vrrp binding admin-vrrp command to check the binding between the object and mVRRP group. The command output includes the bindings between an mVRRP group and a common VRRP backup group, between an mVRRP group and a VRRP-disabled interface, and between an mVRRP group and a service PW. It also includes the statuses of the mVRRP group, common VRRP backup group, VRRP-disabled interface, and service PW.
